alert.note: Alert for Eastern, Central, and Southern Searcy County Higher Elevations; Johnson County Higher Elevations; Newton County Higher Elevations; Newton County Lower Elevations; Northwest Searcy County Higher Elevations; Pope County Higher Elevations; Searcy County Lower Elevations; Southern Pope County; Van Buren County Higher Elevations (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 8:14PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Searcy, southeastern Newton, east central Johnson, northwestern Van Buren and northern Pope Counties through 900 PM CDT... At 813 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles southwest of Piercetown to near Moore to near Bertha to 6 miles northwest of Broomfield. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marshall... Marsena... Witts Spring... Carver... Moore... Duff... Dabney... Point Peter... Bohannon... Imo... Watts... Kay... Dillen... Broomfield... Solo... Smyrna... Eula... Woolum... Piercetown... Bertha... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for western, central and north central Arkansas.
